Described Disease.Described Disease: Autosomal Recessive Juvenile Parkinson's Disease (AR - JP)

Material used.Material Name: TSM1 neurons, SH - SY5Y cells, p19 Arf - 1 - / - and p19 Arf - 1 - / - p53 - / - fibroblasts, wild - type (Pk +) and parkin - deficient (Pk -) fibroblasts
Material used.Description: TSM1 neurons expressing empty vector or wild - type HA - tagged parkin were obtained after transfection. SH - SY5Y cells, p19 Arf - 1 - / - and p19 Arf - 1 - / - p53 - / - fibroblasts, wild - type (Pk +) and parkin - deficient (Pk -) fibroblasts were used as described in the methods section.

Readout description.Conclusion: Varies depending on treatment and genotype
Readout description.Result Description: Wild - type parkin reduced staurosporine - and 6 - hydroxydopamine - induced caspase - 3 activation in TSM1 neurons. In SH - SY5Y cells, wild - type parkin protected from caspase - 3 activation triggered by 6 - OHDA, while parkin mutants did not affect 6 - OHDA - stimulated caspase - 3 activity. Parkin depletion led to an increase in caspase - 3 activity in fibroblasts under control and 6 - OHDA - induced conditions.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the mean ± s.e.m. of multiple independent experiments (number varies for different cell types and experiments, e.g., n = 3 - 10 independent experiments)

Technical replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in duplicate or triplicate depending on the experiment

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analysis was performed with PRISM software using either the t - test Student or Newmann - Keuls multiple comparison tests for one - way analysis of variance.

Material used.Material Source: Cell line, mouse brain, human brain
Material used.Material Name: TSM1 neurons, SH - SY5Y cells, HEK293 cells, primary cultured neurons, parkin knockout murine brains, human brains (control and AR - JP affected)
Material used.Description: Proteins from these materials were separated on 12% SDS - PAGE gels and transferred to membranes for immunoblotting as described in the methods section.

Readout description.Conclusion: Varies depending on genotype and condition
Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of wild - type parkin reduced p53 expression in TSM1 neurons, primary cultured neurons, and SH - SY5Y cells. Parkin depletion increased p53 expression in fibroblasts and mouse brains. Parkin mutations increased p53 expression in AR - JP - affected human brains.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the mean ± s.e.m. of multiple independent experiments (number varies for different cell types and experiments, e.g., n = 3 - 6 independent experiments)

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analysis was performed with PRISM software using either the t - test Student or Newmann - Keuls multiple comparison tests for one - way analysis of variance.

Material used.Material Name: SH - SY5Y cells, TSM1 neurons, fibroblasts
Material used.Description: Cells were transfected with relevant cDNAs and β - galactosidase cDNA to normalize transfection efficiencies as described in the methods section.

Readout description.Conclusion: Varies depending on genotype and condition
Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of wild - type parkin reduced p53 transcriptional activity, promoter transactivation in TSM1 neurons and SH - SY5Y cells. Parkin depletion increased p53 activity and promoter transactivation in fibroblasts. Parkin mutations abolished parkin - induced reduction of p53 promoter transactivation.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the mean ± s.e.m. of multiple independent experiments (number varies for different cell types and experiments, e.g., n = 3 - 10 independent experiments)

Technical replicates.Description: Experiments were performed in duplicate or triplicate depending on the experiment

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analysis was performed with PRISM software using either the t - test Student or Newmann - Keuls multiple comparison tests for one - way analysis of variance.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: RT - PCR analysis of p53 mRNAs in cells and mice brain

Material used.Material Name: TSM1 neurons, primary cultured neurons, fibroblasts, parkin knockout murine brains
Material used.Description: Total RNA was extracted from these materials, reverse transcribed and subjected to real - time PCR as described in the methods section.

Readout description.Conclusion: Varies depending on genotype and condition
Readout description.Result Description: Overexpression of wild - type parkin reduced p53 mRNA levels in TSM1 neurons and primary cultured neurons. Parkin depletion increased p53 mRNA levels in fibroblasts and mouse brains.

Biological replicates.Description: Data represent the mean ± s.e.m. of multiple independent experiments (number varies for different cell types and experiments, e.g., n = 3 - 5 independent experiments)

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical analysis was performed with PRISM software using either the t - test Student or Newmann - Keuls multiple comparison tests for one - way analysis of variance.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with either empty or HA - tagged parkin cDNA vectors, and nuclear extracts were prepared for EMSA.

Readout description.Conclusion: Parkin interacts with the - 312 to - 243 promoter region of p53
Readout description.Result Description: Parkin interacted only with the - 312 to - 243 promoter region of p53 covered by Pp53 - A probe, as shown by gel retardation assays.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated to confirm the results
